content.description:
Sit start with a low left hand two finger incut edge and a perfect right hand pinch up high. From there, reach a left hand sloper-bump, match a right hand next to it, then traverse left along the rail, meet up with

Low Voltage

, gain the right hand crimp, pull to the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The landing is rough but pads nicely.
content.location:
It climbs the north face of Earthshine and starts to the right of

Low Voltage

.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the jug. From there, pull through a right hand edge to reach the sloper bumps above, then gain a right hand crimp, pull to the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A couple of pads. The problem climbs over a pile of rocks, but they pad nicely.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Earthshine.

content.description:
Earthshine climbs an undercut face via interesting movement on good rock.

Sit start with a left hand undercling and a right hand edge. From there, stick a big right hand edge, walk the feet over to a great right heel hook, contain any possible swing, link up to the start jug of

Low Voltage

, anfd climb straight up through edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: Preferably three pads. The landing is okay, but there are several rocks scattered throughout.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Earthshine.
